meanings.definition: At one time in the past
meanings.sent2: She lived in that house once.
meanings.sent3: The old clock struck once and stopped.
meanings.sent4: The memory of that day lingered like a once-forgotten dream.
meanings.sent5: The once bustling street was now quiet and deserted.

meanings.sent1: The twins arrived at the party once.
meanings.sent2: They both spoke at once and confused everyone.
meanings.sent3: The two dancers moved as one, stepping once to the left and once to the right.
meanings.sent4: Their hearts beat once in perfect synchrony.
meanings.sent5: The once inseparable friends now rarely saw each other.

meanings.sent1: He was once a great singer.
meanings.sent2: The town was once a thriving community.
meanings.sent3: The once popular restaurant had lost its charm.
meanings.sent4: The once bright colors of the painting had faded with time.
meanings.sent5: She was once the queen of the stage, now retired and content.

meanings.sent1: Once the bell rings, you can leave.
meanings.sent2: I will call you once I reach home.
meanings.sent3: Once the cake is ready, we can eat it!
meanings.sent4: Once the sun sets, the stars come out to play.
meanings.sent5: Once the storm passes, the sky clears up beautifully.

meanings.sent1: I will forgive you once you apologize.
meanings.sent2: Once you finish your homework, you can play outside.
meanings.sent3: Once you taste this dish, you'll never forget it.
meanings.sent4: Once you see the view from the top, you'll be amazed.
meanings.sent5: Once you hear her sing, you'll be captivated by her voice.

meanings.sent1: The dancers moved once, creating a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent2: The musicians played their instruments once, creating a symphony.
meanings.sent3: The two friends laughed at the same joke once.
meanings.sent4: The birds chirped once, filling the air with music.
meanings.sent5: The once quiet room was now filled with laughter and chatter.
